thread.title: Horse DIES at Cheltenham: Toe The Line put down after collapsing on course
thread.title_full: Horse DIES at Cheltenham: Toe The Line put down after collapsing on course

title: Horse DIES at Cheltenham: Toe The Line put down after collapsing on course
text:
Horse DIES at Cheltenham: Toe The Line put down after collapsing on course Horse DIES at Cheltenham: Toe The Line put down after collapsing on course TOE THE LINE collapsed during the penultimate race of St Patrick's Thursday at Cheltenham Festival and was subsequently confirmed to have died. PUBLISHED: 17:33, Thu, Mar 16, 2017 | UPDATED: 18:27, Thu, Mar 16, 2017 Express Newspapers Cheltenham vets rushed to attend to stricken horse Toe The Line after he collapsed 
Toe The Line started the day as a 22/1 outsider but came into 16/1 for the Mares' Novices' Hurdle. 
However, she barely made it through the opening stages of the race, falling on the flat in the early part of the two-mile trip. Express Newspapers Stewards eventually came on to clear away debris after the ambulances had driven away 
Express Sport understands the horse collapsed on the circuit before green screens were put up to shield the view of the crowd. 
Vets and ambulances rushed to the scene to help the horse but punters feared the worst. GETTY Ruby Walsh grabbed his fourth winner of the day on Let's Dance in the same race 
It was then confirmed that she had been put down after breaking a leg, slipping and coming down the bend. 
Jockey John Kiely was on his first ride of the week but appeared to walk away from the incident unhurt. 
The race was won by favourite Let's Dance with Ruby Walsh on board, the Irishman bagging his fourth winner of the day. 
Toe The Line became the second fatality of the week after JP McManus-owned Consul De Thaix died on Wednesday. Cheltenham Festival 2017: Winners in pictures Thu, March 16, 2017
